text: des Nuria it is my honor to present to
you the graduates
of the class of 2014
the class of 2014
friends and family members of the
Harvard Business School community good
afternoon and welcome one of the hazards
of being Dean is that a few days before
graduation you become totally keen
weather water so all I've been doing for
this whole week is watch the weather and
you can imagine my horror on Tuesday
evening when I learned that there was
gonna be flash floods could you not that
was the better forecast on Tuesday
evening on Wednesday we learned that we
were gonna have the coldest day that
Boston has ever seen in May but every
graduating class has some quality dust
that distinguishes it and so we should
not be surprised that this is what we
expected from the class of 2014 because
when they arrived in our campus in 2012
just a few weeks later it was hurricane
sandy a month later we had a campus-wide
power outage in February of 2013 we had
Blizzard Nimmo mountains of snow all
over this campus and as if that was not
enough
later that year we experienced a flood
in a residence hall and fire and the SFB
apartments
we lived through the Boston Marathon
bombings and the lockdown and manhunt
that followed you shared a deep sadness
over the victims including the daughter
of a her business school staff member
through it all the class of 2014
exhibited patience and grace you thought
of others above yourselves it is this
compassion that will always mark the
class of 2014 and we at Harvard Business
School
are grateful for how you chose to shine
in the face of this adversity so it's
only fitting that as we gather for
commencement today you have the most
beautiful day ever
we hope you graduate today with a rich
set of memories of cases and core calls
you nailed field experiences you enjoyed
friends you laughed or cried with today
as you leave your campus I would like to
offer a last set of thoughts that I hope
you will remember from Casey Gerald's
remarkable speech yesterday
I know that you already know the four PS
the Five Forces and Six Sigma but I'm
gonna keep it simpler I'm gonna talk to
you today about the three T's truth
trust and thankfulness on the Diploma
you will receive today you will find a
seal with the model of Harvard
University which reads Veritas the Latin
word for truth in Roman mythology
Veritas is the goddess of truth the
daughter of Saturn and the mother of
virtue legend has it that Veritas hid in
the bottom of a holy well which is what
makes truth so elusive you've learned
that yourself as you have searched for
the truth in the nearly 500 cases you've
studied you have learned to test these
truths in your case discussions
discussions that very often lead you to
reconsider the positions you held true
when you walked into the classroom this
magical process are forcing you to
defend your positions and at times
watching them crumble in the face of
questions you haven't considered is the
real power of the pedagogy that makes
horror Business School such a special
place I hope it has taught you to keep
asking hard questions considering new
perspectives listening to the views of
others and searching for the underlying
truth in whatever challenges you may
face another sense in which you must
doggedly pursue the truth is to be true
to yourself which includes finding the
path in your life that helps you realize
your highest purpose this too can be
elusive as I have experienced in my own
life as a student in India I studied
Chemical Engineering I was okay at it
but the truth was that I was never going
to be great at it
and I realized it would never be my
calling when I came to MIT as a graduate
student I began working on a PhD in
finance at the time mi t--'s finance
professors were winning Nobel Prizes and
I truly felt fortunate to be in the
midst of such remarkable and brilliant
people yet again I came to the painful
recognition that although I was good at
finance the truth was I was unlikely to
be great at that
either so I switched to the study of
leadership there I finally found a path
that enabled me to pursue my true
calling so search for your true calling
however painful the path to it might be
truth is elusive truth is painful
searching for the truth is hard but so
is speaking the truth and hearing the
truth the narrative of every business
candle think of Enron as a
representative case usually has someone
who recognized the truth of what was
happening and tried to stop it speaking
these truths takes courage entails risks
and can result in frustration because
people in power don't always listen yet
you must always have the courage to
speak the truth indeed as you progress
through your career into leadership
positions you must remain keenly aware
of how difficult it can be for truths to
trickle up in an organization as a
leader is your job to try and create a
safe and open culture where people feel
comfortable delivering bad news up the
chain of command and where it's okay to
speak truth to power the second tea I
ask you to reflect on today is trust
Trust has a deep relationship with truth
it's an emotional bond that develops
between people or institutions who have
grown accustomed to observing each other
act in truthful and appropriate ways
Trust is one of the greatest assets you
can possess as an individual or as a
business when I think about the quality
of trust I think about two important
lessons I learned from my father one
about personal trust and one about the
trust that exists between business and
society
as the CEO of a company in India my
father negotiated hundreds of
partnerships and deals over his career
when I would talk to him of his work he
but very often referred to his level of
trust in the other party he might say
we've signed an airtight contract but I
don't fully trust the person I'm dealing
with so I expect there will still be
problems or he'd say this person's word
is good even though our contractual
terms aren't as favorable as I would
have liked this should work out well I
think of my father's impressions of his
partners as a reminder that many of our
best professional relationships will be
based on an assessment of the trust that
you place in others and that may be far
more important than the language of
contracts as you move through your
career you should aspire to build a
reputation for being trustworthy I
promise you it will be your best
investment as it will pay rich dividends
all your life when we think of trust we
should not only think about
relationships between people but also
between institutions as we stand here
today in nearly five years after the
great financial crisis the relationship
between business and society is one in
which still in which trust still seems
to be alarmingly low there was a time
when people saw businesses as engines
that propel propel society's prosperity
but today too many people view business
leaders with mistrust this is one of the
great problems of our era one that I
hope your generation will and must
address I find this shift in public
attitude towards business particularly
upsetting because the second enduring
lesson I learned from my father was the
power of business to improve people's
lives my father grew up in a village in
India with no electricity he had to read
by candle lights with no fans or air
conditioning
in a house where temperatures routinely
reached 110 degrees during the summer
when he became CEO he ran a company that
electrified India and while he certainly
took an interest in its profits and
losses he was driven by the sense that
his company was making customers lives
better
after all he knew what it was like to
live without electricity
billions of people in the world still
live without electricity
my father's example gave me the palpable
sense that businesses have a unique
capacity to make the world a better
place and a sense of purpose that has
inspired me to devote my life to
educating business leaders so as you
pursue your own goals I hope you will
behave in a way that not only leads to
others placing personal trust in you but
that you also act in a way that rebuilds
trust between business and society the
world needs more trust and businesses
and the leaders because there is no more
powerful force to help solve societal
problems and to enable billions of
people to live more prosperous lives
finally the last tea
I would like to urge all of you to
reflect on and display thankfulness
those of us who are gathered here today
are enormous ly blessed and our good
fortune can create the risk of
distancing us from people who are less
fortunate this can be a special problem
for people in leadership roles remaining
mindful of our blessings and showing
thanks for them is the difference
between being experienced as entitled
versus being experienced as a true
leader expressing thankfulness also
increases your own happiness
thankfulness creates a virtuous circle
the more you express it the more reasons
you have to express it I have
experienced this virtuous circle in my
own life I have two daughters who are
now 19 and 17 at this age they no longer
let me read them bedside bedtime stories
indeed I can scarcely get them to talk
to me in full sentences but for many
years when they were younger there was a
daily ritual I enjoyed very much each
evening just before my children went to
sleep I would ask them to say three
thank-yous the three thank-yous meant
that each child had to name three things
she was grateful for that day it was
interesting to hear what they would say
often they'd start with obvious answers
I'm grateful for my dad reading me a
book tonight or I'm grateful for my
family
but by the time they got to their third
thank you they'd start straining to
think of something and those third
thank-yous could be revealing which
teachers were they thankful for which
friendships that they truly value how
often did they mention privileges they
had that others didn't when I began
doing this exercise with my daughter's I
also began doing it for myself
and even though my daughters have now
I've grown it
I still do it every night just before I
go to sleep I think about three specific
things I'm grateful for I feel pretty
lucky most days
but even at the end of a very bad day
I'm usually struck by the abundance of
choices I have for my three thank yous I
promise you if you incorporate this
ritual in your life you will wake up
every day feeling great about your life
your class has shown a special
appreciation for the power of saying
thank you last spring you created the
first-ever staff appreciation day at
Harvard Business School you sent nine
hundred handwritten notes to staff
members you offered them standing
ovations it took them to lunch you put
up banners I hope you will continue to
show this gratitude for the many people
who make an organization run often
unsung and unrecognized but they will
help every organization you're a part of
throughout your lives be better on a day
like this it's especially appropriate to
express your thankfulness to those who
have helped you get here and to make it
through the last two years so members of
the class of 2014
stand up turn around
as much as today is a celebration of you
and what you've accomplished
none of it would be possible without the
strong support you've received from
others the husbands wives and partners
the parents sisters and brothers aunts
uncles cousins and friends who've
nurtured you encouraged you and believed
in you please join me in giving them a
big hand of applause ok turn back the
faculty and I join your families in
congratulating you on all you have
accomplished during your time with us we
celebrate you and we wish you good
fortune as you begin your next
adventures remember leadership is about
competence and character and as you
think about continuing to build your
character in the years ahead
I hope you will reflect on how the three
T's can help in this work seek the truth
in all that you do create and build
relationships grounded and trust and
show thankfulness for the many blessings
in your life be assured that everyone
here at Harvard Business School will be
rooting for you to become leaders who
will make a difference in the world and
in the lives of those you touch as you
commence this exciting journey I wish
you Godspeed
